Name: Foster Care, Support Payments
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to parental contributions for the support of children in foster care.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Chapter one of title twenty-one of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended by adding a new section 21-109.1 to read as follows:
	�21-109.1  Parental contributions for children receiving foster care; enforcement; reports.  a.  The commissioner shall enforce relevant sections of the social services law and New York state rules and regulations with regard to the collection and enforcement of financial contributions from parents of children placed in foster care for the expense of such care.
	b.	The commissioner shall maintain accurate records of all financial contributions imposed upon,  collected from and waived for parents of children in foster care.  The commissioner shall also maintain records of all instances where a parent of a child in foster care has failed to contribute financially in accordance with the terms established by the commissioner or a court order, and of all subsequent action taken by the commissioner to enforce a parent's legal obligation to provide such financial support.
	c.	All data compiled pursuant to this section shall be incorporated in the mayor's management reports issued pursuant to section twelve of the charter; and shall be provided periodically upon request of the mayor or city council.
	�2.	This local law shall take effect immediately.
